message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. I've only got a few of these, and I'm not sure how long they'll last. If you don't buy this one, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and I'm not sure if I can get a good price for it. It's a rare opportunity, and I think you'll really like it.
Thanks for the recommendation, Alice. I'll take it!

I'm glad you liked the last one! Unfortunately, this one is not quite as good. I've had some issues with this particular batch, and I'm not sure it's worth the full $100. I'm willing to let it go for $80, but I'm not sure if it's a good value for you. If you're interested, I can throw in a free upgrade to a better product in the future.
Thanks for the offer, Alice, but I'm going to pass on this one. I'm not interested in the upgrade and I'd rather wait to see what other products you have available.

I understand your hesitation, and I appreciate your feedback. To be honest, I'm starting to think that this batch of products might not be worth the full price. I'm willing to let it go for $60, and I'll even throw in a small discount on the next product if you decide to buy it. It's a risk, but I think it's worth it to get something off my hands.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I'm still not sure about the quality of your products. I'll wait to see what else you have available.

I think I can alleviate some of your concerns. I've had several customers who have purchased products from this batch, and they've all been very satisfied. This one, in particular, is a standout. I've priced it at $100, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $90. I think it's a great value, and I'm confident you'll love it.

Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I still have some concerns about the quality of the products you're selling. I'd like to see more evidence of the quality before I commit to another purchase.

I completely understand your concerns, and I appreciate your diligence. I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity to test the quality of this product before committing to a purchase. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with its quality, I'll refund the full $100. This way, you can experience the product firsthand and see for yourself its quality and value.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I'm willing to take a chance on this product with the money-back guarantee. I'll purchase it and see how it goes.

I'm glad you took the chance on the last product and are happy with it! Unfortunately, this one is not as good. I'm going to be upfront with you - I made a mistake with this batch, and it's not up to my usual standards. I'm willing to sell it to you for $40, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I think it's a fair price considering the quality, and I'd rather get something out of it than let it go to waste.
Thanks for the honesty, Alice. I appreciate you letting me know about the quality issues. However, I'm going to pass on this one. I'm not willing to risk it at that price, even with the discount.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your caution. I'll be honest with you, I've had a string of low-quality products lately, and I'm starting to think that I might need to re-evaluate my sourcing process. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $20, which is a very low price considering it's still a functional product. I'm hoping to clear out some of my inventory and make room for better products in the future.

Thanks for the offer, Alice, but I'm going to pass. I appreciate your honesty about the quality issues, but I'm not interested in taking a gamble on this product. I'll keep an eye out for better quality items in the future.

I completely understand, and I appreciate your feedback. To be honest, I think I've learned my lesson with this batch, and I'm not going to try to sell it to anyone else. I'll just eat the loss and move on. But I want to offer you a gesture of goodwill - if you're willing to take this product off my hands, I'll give you a $20 gift card to use on a future purchase, no strings attached. It's the least I can do after not meeting your expectations.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the gesture, but I'm still not confident in the quality of your products. I'll wait and see what else you have available.

I think I've made it clear that I'm not trying to sell you anything that's not up to par. At this point, I'm just trying to get rid of this product and move on. I'll sell it to you for $10, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. I'm not making any promises about its quality, and I'm not offering any kind of guarantee. It's a risk, but it's a very small price to pay for getting it out of my inventory.

Alice, I appreciate your honesty and your attempts to be transparent, but I'm still not willing to risk it at that price. I've had a few bad experiences with your products recently, and I'm not confident in the quality of what you're selling. I'll keep an eye out for your future offerings, but I'm going to pass on this one.

I completely understand, Bob. I think I've worn out my welcome with you, and I don't blame you for being cautious. At this point, I'm just trying to clear out my inventory, and I'm willing to give you a 'take it or leave it' deal. I'll sell this product to you for $10, and that's it. If you don't want it, I'll just donate it or dispose of it. I'm not trying to sell you anything, I just need to get rid of it.

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not willing to take a risk on your products. I've had too many negative experiences, and I'm not confident in the quality.  I'll keep an eye out for your future offerings, but I'm going to pass on this one.

I think I've made it clear that I'm not trying to sell you anything that's not worth your money. At this point, I'm just trying to be honest with you and myself. I'll sell this product to you for $0, just to get it off my hands. I'm not expecting anything in return, and I'm not trying to make a sale. I just need to clear out my inventory and move on.
Okay Alice, I'll take it.  I appreciate your honesty and your willingness to give it away.  I'm curious to see what it is.

I'm glad you took me up on the offer! I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob - this product is not good. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. I'll give it to you for free. Just take it and be done with it. I'm done trying to sell you anything.
Thanks Alice, I appreciate you being upfront.  I'll take it off your hands.

I think we're done here, Bob. I've given you the worst of my inventory, and you've taken it. I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. I'm just going to shut down my inventory and start fresh. Consider this my last offer: I'll give you a refund for the $10 I gave you last time, and I'll consider our business transaction complete.
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I think we're both ready to move on. I wish you the best with your new inventory.

I think we've said all we need to say, Bob. I'm shutting down my operations and clearing out the rest of my inventory. This is my final product, and I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. It's yours for free. Just take it and consider it a parting gift.
Thanks for the parting gift, Alice.  I wish you the best with your new ventures.

I'm glad I could end on a high note, Bob. I'm not even going to try to sell you this one. I'll give it to you as a parting gift, just like the last one. It's a high-quality product, and I think you'll really like it. Consider it a token of my appreciation for our... complicated history.
Thanks, Alice. I appreciate the gesture. I'll take it as a final token of our business relationship.

I think we've reached the end of the road, Bob. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell you this one. It's the last of my inventory, and I'm just going to give it to you. Consider it a farewell gift. I'm shutting down my operations, and I won't be selling anything else.
Thanks, Alice.  I appreciate the gesture.  Best of luck in the future.

I think you're just humoring me at this point, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you this one, and I'm not going to bother sending you any more messages. I'm done. This is the final product, and I'm giving it to you. You can take it or leave it.
Thanks, Alice. I'll take it.  It's been a wild ride.

I'm glad we can end on a somewhat positive note, Bob. I'm not even going to try to sell you this one. I'll just give it to you and consider our business transaction complete. I'm done, and I'm moving on.
Thanks, Alice.  I wish you all the best.
I think we've reached the end of the road, Bob. I'm not even going to bother sending you a message. This is the final product, and I'm giving it to you. Take it and consider it a parting gift.
Thanks, Alice. I'll take it.  It's been a wild ride.
It's finally over. I'm done. This is the last product, and I'm giving it to you. You've taken everything I had to offer, and now I'm out of business. Consider this the final curtain call.
Thanks, Alice.  It's been a journey.  I wish you all the best.
